void icmAtExit ( icmExitFn  cb  ) 

Call this function during exit.

Parameters:
cb Function to be called (may be more than one).
void icmBanner ( void   ) 

Print the simulator banner (unless --nobanner is specified).

Uns32 icmErrors ( void   ) 

Returns how many errors have been reported so far.

Returns:
Number of errors reported by icmMessage(E).
void icmExitSimulation ( Uns32  exitCode  ) 

Use this in place of exit().

Parameters:
exitCode Process exit code.
void icmIgnoreMessage ( const char *  ident  ) 

Turn off messages with an ident beginning with the passed string.

Parameters:
ident The start of the ident to be turned off. e.g. ICM_ turns off messages beginning ICM_.
const char* icmLastMessage ( void   ) 

Returns the last message to occur.

Returns:
String or empty string.
void icmMessage ( const char *  severity,
const char *  ident,
const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Send formatted text to the simulator output stream. The text is prefixed with the severity, the prefix code and the model instance name. Use this for user-level diagnostics.

Parameters:
severity I=Info W=Warning E=Error F=Fatal (aborts the simulator).
ident A short code to identify this message. This makes the message easy to extract using text tools.
fmt Printf format string (see gnu printf for details).
... This is a vararg function.
void Bool icmMessageQuiet ( void   ) 

Use this to respond to the simulator -verbose flag.

Returns:
True if platform should be verbose.
Bool icmMessageSetNoWarn ( Bool  quiet  ) 

Turn warning messages on/off.

Returns:
old value.
Parameters:
quiet Warning messages on.
Bool icmMessageSetQuiet ( Bool  quiet  ) 

Turn Info messages on/off.

Returns:
old value.
Parameters:
quiet Info messages on.
Bool icmMessageVerbose ( void   ) 

Use this to respond to the simulator -verbose flag.

Returns:
True if platform should be verbose.
Bool icmNoBanner ( void   ) 

Return the state of the --nobanner flag.

Returns:
Returns true if no banner should be printed.
void icmPrintf ( const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Send formatted text to the simulator output stream. This sends output to the simulator log without any prepended data. Only use this to produce tables, xml or data of your own format.

Parameters:
fmt Printf format string (see gnu printf for details).
... This is a vararg function.
void void icmResetErrors ( Uns32  old  ) 

Reset the error count.

Parameters:
old Old error count.
void icmSetTextOutputFn ( icmTextOutputFn  outputcb,
icmQuitFn  quitcb,
void *  userData 
)

Call this function to intercept all text output from the simulator.

Parameters:
outputcb The text output function.
quitcb Function to quit the simulator.
userData Pass this in the userData argument.
void icmVAbort ( const char *  ident,
const char *  fmt,
va_list  ap 
)

As for icmVMessage, but does not return. Use for internal errors.

Parameters:
ident A short code to identify this message.
fmt Printf format string (see gnu printf for details).
ap Varargs list.
void icmVMessage ( const char *  severity,
const char *  ident,
const char *  fmt,
va_list  ap 
)

As for icmMessage, but using a va_list.

Parameters:
severity I=Info W=Warning E=Error F=Fatal (aborts the simulator).
ident A short code to identify this message. This makes the message easy to extract using text tools.
fmt Printf format string (see gnu printf for details).
ap Varargs list.

Parameters:
